review_title: I wouldn't recommend it at all
cons: There is no opportunity for development or further training. Appraisals and meetings are just box ticking exercises that don't mean anything and go nowhere. I agree with the other reviewer who said the job eats away at your soul! I left here feeling less confident in my abilities than I did when I started. The job would be fine for someone who wants to come in, put their head phones on, work to a basic standard and not be spoken to all day. If you expect anything more from an employer, like being invested in (don't let the Investors In People logo fool you) or listened to, go elsewhere. I also agree with others who have said that it's far from great for disabled people and other minorities. When people leave they tell each other "good for you for getting out." It was the only option to save my mental health from declining further.
